title: David Attenborough's 100th Birthday Party on TV
summary: The BBC is planning a big celebration for Sir David Attenborough's 100th birthday in May. They will have a special week of TV shows to honor him. There will be three new programs. One is called Making Life on Earth: Attenborough's Greatest Adventure, which shows how they made an old series from 1979 where David traveled to many countries to film animals. Another is Secret Garden, where David explores gardens in Britain to find hidden wildlife. The last is David Attenborough's 100 Years on Planet Earth, a live event with music and guests. The week will also include old favorite shows like Planet Earth and Blue Planet. The BBC says David's shows help people learn about nature and care for the planet. This is a fun way to say thank you to David for his amazing work.

background_read: Sir David Attenborough is a well-known British broadcaster who has been making TV shows about wildlife and nature for many years. He is loved by people all over the world for teaching them about animals and the environment. The BBC is a big television network in the UK that produces educational and entertainment programs. Celebrating a 100th birthday is a rare and special event, and the BBC wants to honor David's contributions by showing his best work and new programs. This helps kids understand why it's important to appreciate nature and learn from experts like David.
